recipe_card: 12 Miso Soup Recipes That Are Full of Flavor
recipe_name: 12 Miso Soup Recipes That Are Full of Flavor

recipe_card: Vegan Japanese Winter Squash and Leek Soup 7 Ratings
recipe_name: Vegan Japanese Winter Squash and Leek Soup
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (2 pound) Japanese winter squash (kabocha), halved and seeded"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons canola oil, or more as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large sweet onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large leeks - white part cut horizontally and green parts cut lengthwise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups water, or more as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 small russet potatoes, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large carrots, cut into rounds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups vegetable stock, or more if needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch garlic salt, or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"ground black pepper to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Arrange squash, cut-side up, on a baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until squash is tender, 30 to 40 minutes; cool slightly. Remove skin from squash and chop the flesh."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat canola oil in a large pot over medium heat; cook and stir onion and white parts of leek until golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix water, green parts of leeks, potatoes, baked squash, and carrots to onion mixture; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover pot, and simmer, stirring every 10 minutes and adding more water as needed, until vegetables are tender, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour vegetable stock into vegetable mixture; season with garlic salt and pepper. Raise temperature to medium and cook until boiling, 15 to 20 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Quick Miso Soup
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon canola oil, or more as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  large shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch fresh chives, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, peeled and sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ (14 ounce) package firm tofu, cubed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (14 ounce) can low-sodium beef broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (14 ounce) can low-sodium chicken broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ½ tablespoons white miso paste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, chives, and garlic slices; cook for 1 minute. Add tofu and cook for 2 minutes. Pour in beef broth and chicken broth, then stir in miso paste until dissolved."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Ladle into bowls to serve."}]

recipe_card: Kitsune Udon
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Soup Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Noodle Soup Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ounce kombu (Japanese dried kelp)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5 cups cold water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup bonito flakes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ounces aburaage (frozen, defrosted fried tofu cakes)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ½ tablespoons soy sauce, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons mirin, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound frozen udon noodles"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons thinly sliced scallions"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Break kombu into 2-inch pieces; this should equal about 2 cups, loosely packed. Bring water and kombu to a gentle boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat; boil for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, then remove and discard kombu. Sprinkle in bonito flakes and bring to a simmer over medium heat, about 2 minutes. Once simmering, remove from heat, strain, and discard solids. Place dashi back into the saucepan and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Place aburaage in a medium bowl. Cover with hot water and let soak until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Strain, allow to cool briefly until cool enough to handle, and gently press aburaage with your hands to squeeze out any excess water."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring 1 cup dashi, 1 1/2 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon mirin, and sugar to a boil in another medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce to a simmer over medium-low heat and add the soaked aburaage. Cook, covered, until the majority of the liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Flip aburaage halfway through."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring the remaining 4 cups of dashi to a gentle boil over medium heat. Stir in salt, remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce, and remaining 1 tablespoon mirin. Add frozen udon noodles; cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until noodles have separated and are tender yet firm to the bite, about 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Divide noodles and broth evenly into 2 bowls. Top with seasoned aburaage and sliced scallions."}]

recipe_card: Spicy Miso Soup with Roasted Shiitake Mushrooms and Green Beans 6 Ratings
recipe_name: Spicy Miso Soup with Roasted Shiitake Mushrooms and Green Beans
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6 ounces shiitake mushrooms, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon olive oil, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons sea salt, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 ounces green beans, cut into thirds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups vegetable broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  Thai chile, scored"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons yellow miso paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons hot water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) package dried rice noodles"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  large egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  green onions, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 sheet Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 sheet Reynolds® Parchment Paper"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 400 degrees F and line a baking sheet with Reynolds® Parchment Paper. Place mushrooms on baking sheet and drizzle with half the olive oil and half the salt. Set aside momentarily."},{"recipe_directions":"Center green beans on a sheet of Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil and drizzle with remaining olive oil and salt. Fold over edges of foil to create a packet. Ensure it is tightly sealed."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the mushrooms and the foil pack of green beans in the oven and roast for 10 minutes, stirring the mushrooms halfway through."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat vegetable broth to a low simmer in a medium pot. Pour in the soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar. Add the whole Thai chili to simmering broth (this will be removed later)."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk the miso paste with hot water in small bowl until smooth then add to the broth. Continue to simmer for an additional 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Cook noodles according to package directions while the broth is simmering. When the noodles are done, evenly divide them into two serving bowls."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring a small pot of water to a boil and carefully drop in the egg to cook for 6 minutes. Remove from water and peel."},{"recipe_directions":"Divide the mushrooms and green beans between the two bowls and then pour the broth evenly between the bowls."},{"recipe_directions":"Slice the egg in half and place 1 half in each bowl. Garnish with sliced green onion."}]

recipe_card: Restaurant-Style Shoyu Miso Ramen 1 Rating
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Soup Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Noodle Soup Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup dried black fungus"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups mirin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups soy sauce, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6  green onion bulbs, chopped, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  onion, coarsely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 cloves garlic, peeled"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 pounds skin-on, boneless pork belly"},{"recipe_ingredients":"butcher's twine"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup miso paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 (3 ounce) packages ramen noodles, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 sheets nori (dry seaweed), quartered"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  naruto (fish paste stick with a red spiral pattern). sliced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Place black fungus in a large bowl and fill with water."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine mirin, 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 3 green onion bulbs, chopped onion, and garlic in an oven-safe pot over high heat. Bring to a boil."},{"recipe_directions":"Place pork belly skin-side down on a flat work surface. Roll up lengthwise and wrap with butcher's twine. Place pork belly in the pot with the mirin mixture and partially cover with a lid."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until pork is tender and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), about 4 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring a separate pot of water to a boil over high heat. Gently place eggs in the pot and cook until yolks are barely set, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer eggs to a bowl filled with ice water. Let sit, about 1 minute. Remove from water and peel eggs."},{"recipe_directions":"Place eggs in a container with 1 cup water, 1/2 cup soy sauce, and 2 tablespoons brown sugar. Dampen a paper towel in the mixture and use it to cover the container. Refrigerate 4 hours to overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Drain the fungus and add to the liquid in the pot with the pork belly. Cover with a lid and refrigerate, 4 hours to overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Skim fungus from the top of the pork belly mixture and place in a pot with 8 cups water; fungus should be covered in pork belly fat. Add 1/4 cup soy sauce and miso paste. Bring to a boil."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove skin from the pork belly using a knife. Chop the meat into pieces of desired thickness. Cut eggs in half lengthwise."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring a separate pot of water to a boil. Cook ramen in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender, yet firm to the bite, about 3 minutes. Drain."},{"recipe_directions":"Place 4 slices of nori diagonally in the corner of each bowl. Place noodles on top; arrange 2 egg halves and a few pork belly slices in separate corners. Cover with black fungus, top with green onions, and pour in broth. Top each bowl with a few slices of naruto. Let sit, about 3 minutes, before serving."}]

recipe_card: Japanese Shoyu Ramen (Pressure Cooker) 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (2 1/2 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup dried scallops"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup dried anchovies"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup dried shrimp"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup bonito flakes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1 inch) piece ginger, thinly slices, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (4 inch) piece dashi kombu (dried kelp)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 quarts water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup mirin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup sake"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8  green onions"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup bonito flakes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8 cloves garlic, crushed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (4 inch) piece dashi kombu (dried kelp)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 (3 ounce) packages cooked ramen noodles, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place chicken, scallops, anchovies, shrimp, bonito flakes, half the ginger, and kombu in an electric pressure cooker. Add water; close and lock the lid. Select the Soup setting; set timer for 90 minutes according to manufacturer's instructions. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build."},{"recipe_directions":"Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Strain broth through a colander or fine-mesh sieve. Skim the fatty oil off the top of the broth."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, green onions, bonito flakes, sugar, garlic, and kombu in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until flavors blend, about 10 minutes. Strain tare sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour 2 tablespoons of tare sauce into a large bowl. Ladle in about 2 cups of broth. Add 1/6 of the ramen noodles. Repeat with remaining tare, broth, and ramen."}]

recipe_card: Traditional Beef Sukiyaki 2 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Soup Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Beef Soup Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup sake"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound thinly sliced beef"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (12 ounce) package firm tofu, drained and cut into bite-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ head Chinese cabbage, cut into bite-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (7 ounce) package yam noodles (shirataki), drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"7  shiitake mushrooms, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  enoki mustrooms, roots removed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  green onion (negi), sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  eggs"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine water, soy sauce, sugar, and sake in a bowl to make broth."},{"recipe_directions":"Arrange beef, tofu, Chinese cabbage, yam noodles, shiitake mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, and green onion on separate plates on the table."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in an electric skillet or a large skillet set over a hot plate at the table. Add beef slices; cook and stir until browned, about 1 minute. Pour in some broth; bring to a boil. Stir in tofu, cabbage, noodles, shiitake mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, and green onion; simmer until softened, about 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Ladle cooked sukiyaki mixture into serving bowls. Replenish broth in the skillet."},{"recipe_directions":"Crack each egg into a small bowl and beat lightly. Serve sukiyaki alongside eggs for dipping."}]

recipe_card: Authentic Japanese Scallop Soup with Ramen Noodles 8 Ratings
recipe_name: Authentic Japanese Scallop Soup with Ramen Noodles
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (3 ounce) package instant ramen noodles (exclude seasoning packet)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ½ cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons mirin (Japanese sweet wine)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ⅓ teaspoons dashi broth powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  shiitake mushrooms, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  green onions, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8  scallops"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Add ramen and cook, breaking up noodles as they soften, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 3 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain again. Divide noodles between two soup bowls."},{"recipe_directions":"While the ramen is cooking, bring 2 1/2 cups water to a boil in a separate pot. Stir in soy sauce, mirin, dashi powder, and rice vinegar. Reduce the heat to low and add mushrooms, green onions, and ginger; simmer until mushrooms are tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Turn off the heat and cover to keep warm."},{"recipe_directions":"Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add scallops and cook until opaque in the middle and golden brown on the edges, about 2 minutes per side."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour 1/2 of the hot stock into each bowl over ramen, then top with scallops."}]

recipe_card: Japanese Soup with Tofu and Mushrooms 25 Ratings
recipe_name: Japanese Soup with Tofu and Mushrooms
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups prepared dashi stock"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup sliced shiitake mushrooms"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon miso paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ cup cubed soft tofu"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  green onion, chopped"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Bring dashi stock to a boil in a medium saucepan; reduce heat to simmer, add mushrooms, and cook for 3 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix miso paste and soy sauce together in a small bowl; stir into stock along with tofu. Simmer for 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Serve topped with green onion."}]

recipe_card: Seaweed (Nori) Soup 7 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound ground pork"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 quarts water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cube chicken bouillon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) can sliced water chestnuts"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 sheets nori (dry seaweed), broken into pieces."},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  green onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ teaspoon sesame oil"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Cook ground pork in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until browned. Drain off excess fat and add water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium, and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir in bouillon cube to dissolve. Add water chestnuts and nori. Stir in egg and season with salt. Remove from heat and mix in green onions and sesame oil. Serve immediately."}]

recipe_card: Konbu Dashi 5 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Broth and Stock Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (4 inch) piece dashi kombu (dried kelp)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups water"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Wipe kombu with a damp cloth to clean it. Cut into 1-inch pieces and place in a saucepan with water. Bring to a boil; reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand for a few minutes. Strain through a mesh strainer before using."}]

recipe_card: Japanese Onion Soup 117 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ stalk celery, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  carrot, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon minced fresh garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons chicken stock"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 teaspoons beef bouillon granules"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup chopped fresh shiitake mushrooms"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 quarts water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup baby portobello mushrooms, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon minced fresh chives"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"In a large saucepan or stockpot, combine the celery, onion, carrot, ginger, garlic, and a few of the mushrooms. Add chicken stock, beef bouillon, and water. Place the pot over high heat, and bring to a rolling boil. When the mixture reaches boiling, cover, reduce heat to medium, and cook for 45 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Place all of the remaining mushrooms into a separate pot. When the boiling mixture is done, place a strainer over the pot with the mushrooms in it. Strain the cooked soup into the pot with the mushrooms. Discard strained materials."},{"recipe_directions":"Serve the broth with mushrooms in small porcelain bowls, and sprinkle fresh chives over the top. Use Asian soup spoons for an elegant effect."}]

recipe_card: How to Make Dashi Stock for Miso Soups and More
recipe_name: How to Make Dashi Stock for Miso Soups and More

recipe_card: Japanese Nabeyaki Udon Soup 42 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Soup Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Noodle Soup Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6 cups prepared dashi stock"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ pound chicken, cut into chunks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  carrots, diced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons mirin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (12 ounce) packages firm tofu, cubed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ pound shiitake mushrooms, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  ribs and leaves of bok choy, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (9 ounce) package fresh udon noodles"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  leeks, diced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat dashi stock, chicken, carrots, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and salt in a pot over medium heat. Simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 5 to 7 minutes. Add tofu, mushrooms, and bok choy, stirring until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes more."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir udon noodles into broth and simmer until tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Add leeks and crack eggs into soup; simmer until eggs are slightly firm, about 5 minutes more."}]

recipe_card: Miso Soup with Shiitake Mushrooms 36 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups vegetable broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  shiitake mushrooms, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup miso paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 teaspoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup diced firm tofu"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  green onions, trimmed and thinly sliced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Bring the vegetable broth to a boil in a saucepan. Add the mushrooms, reduce heat to low, and simmer 4 minutes. Stir the miso paste and soy sauce together in a small bowl; add to the broth along with the tofu and continue cooking for 1 minute more. Pour the soup into bowls and top with the green onions to serve."}]

recipe_card: Dashi Stock (Konbudashi) 12 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Broth and Stock Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ounce dashi kombu (dried kelp)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 quart water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup bonito flakes"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Wipe away any dirt from the kombu with a paper towel, being careful not to rub off the white powdery deposits on the seaweed. Place the kombu and water in a saucepan, and allow it to soak for 30 minutes to become soft."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove the kombu from the water, and cut several lengthwise slits into the leaf. Return the kombu to the water, and bring it to a boil. As soon as the water begins to boil, remove the kombu to prevent the stock from becoming bitter."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir the bonito flakes into the kombu-flavored water, bring back to a boil, and take the pan off the heat. Allow the water to cool. When the bonito flakes have settled to the bottom, strain the dashi through a strainer lined with cheesecloth or a coffee filter."}]

recipe_card: Authentic Miso Soup 36 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (4 inch) piece dashi kombu (dried kelp)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup bonito flakes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 ounces tofu, cut into chunks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon dried wakame"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons miso paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chopped green onions"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat water in a large pot over low heat. Add kombu and cook until just simmering. Stir in bonito flakes, then remove dashi stock from the heat. Let dashi sit, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Strain and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 3 1/2 cups dashi in a pot over medium heat. Add tofu and wakame and stir to combine. Remove 1 cup warmed dashi to a small bowl and whisk in miso paste. Pour miso mixture back into the pot with remaining dashi. Stir until warmed through. Serve garnished with chopped green onions."}]
